_header: O love til restore thy expellent loss
_description: A Scottish version of a portion of Lydgate’s ‘Cristes Passioun’ (3388), perhaps by Dunbar—four 8-line stanzas

CamMagPep1576.First Lines:
O luue tyll restor þi expellens & los ffrome
                        par paradyce place off most plessance…
CamMagPep1576.Last Lines:
…suerdis staffys & stauis importabill Cryande terandly
                    hydwys
CamMagPep1576.Note: Added to originally blank verso of last leaf
CamMagPep1576.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             Bibliotheca Pepysiana: A Descriptive Catalogue of the Library of Samuel
                Pepys. Pt. III: Medieval Manuscripts.
         London, 1923: 3.16-17.
Nichols,  Pierrepont H. 
             “William Dunbar as a Scottish Lydgatian.” 
             PMLA
         46 (1931): 214-24: 220-1.
